main event: Several weather observers in Yuma, Arizona saw a flat white object with a circular shape and a short tail on April 17, 1950.
interesting points: The object was described as being flat white in color with a very erratic trajectory., It was too fast for the observers to track with a theodolite., The object emitted a thin intermittent vapor trail that was one to two diameters long., Observers were unable to determine the exact speed or altitude of the object., The sightings were corroborated by multiple observers who had never seen anything like it before.
sighted object: flat white circular object with a short tail
